lines.text: Yeah, well, this is is Rock & Roll High School.
Rock & Roll High School?
Do your parents *know* that you're Ramones?
The only thing I'll ever lay is a rug!
Those Ramones are peculiar.
They're ugly. Ugly, ugly people.
[after using Ramones music to make a mouse explode in a puff of smoke]
Notice the loss of hearing.
The gym!
Girls!
Music!
Legs!
Dancing!
Boobs!
Randell!
Sex...
I think they're trying to tell us something.

[singing]
You heard that I'm no good/Yeah, yeah, I'm no good/But I'll treat you like I should/I want you around/I want you around...
BODY SEARCH!

[singing]
Rock Rock, Rock Rock, Rock and Roll High School...
[BOOM! The school blows up]
Look at your math book; it looks brand new. Bet you've never even opened it.
I only use it on special equations
Tom Roberts is so boring his brother is an only child.
[last lines]
Well, that about wraps it up here at Rock & Roll High. Remember, if your principal ever gives *you* trouble, if you want *this*
[pointing to the burning school building behind him]
to happen at your school, you just give ol' Screamin' Steve a call. I'm in the book - under SCARRRREAMIN'!
She's my friend.
A friend that will lead you down the road to expulsion.

[air guitar]
I'm a teenage lobotomy.
Oh, I'm sorry. We don't let any more mice in here. They've been exploding all over the place.
Screw you, Principal Togar, we made it to the concert anyway!
Things sure have changed since we got kicked out of high school.

[needs to see Eaglebauer]
Miss, you don't understand. See, uh, this is an emergency.
Animal, vegetable, or mineral?
Um... sexual.

[Togar has cut the wire on her broadcast equipment]
Hey, Kate, I'm getting some static.
Not as much as you're going to get.
I'm Riff Randell, rock-and-roller.
You two are not doing your job. Look at me when I'm talking to you! You're supposed to be my eyes, my ears, my nose.

[Hansel and Gretel sneeze; Togar wipes her nose]
Thank you.
This... is the Rock-o-meter.
Gee!

[to Hansel and Gretel]
Oh, go and monitor the halls!

[to Mr. McGree]
Oh, sorry, Mantovani's down the block.
I'm hep, Daddy-o. I'm into the Ramones.
This will never work. Tom will never like me; I don't know who I'm kidding. What possible reason could there be to put myself through all this? Sex!
[chuckles]
I must admit, as far as reasons go, it's must be one of the best.
I'm *first* in line! And if you don't like it, you can put it where the monkey puts the nuts!
I don't wanna have fun! I wanna be with Tom!

[classy]
Come on, sexy.
Well, I think that should teach them a lesson in deportment.
How do you spell that?
D-e-portment.
I'd like to introduce the two winners of the charity ticket raffle donated by the principal of Vince Lombardi High.

[yells]
Togar eats it!

[holding phone to radio broadcasting live Ramones concert]
That, Mrs. Rambeau, is where your daughter is.

[over phone]
My daughter, Kate? I thought she was in the basement splitting photons.
Don't dance near the chemicals!
DEMERIT! DEMERIT!
